page.title: 10COMBE FARM N HARRIS
page.content: The main enterprises at Combe Farm in 1985 were Beef and Lamb production, pig fattening and corn growing. The cattle are mainly Herefords but we also have some continental breeds including Charolais, Limousin and Simmental.They are bought on as calves and grown on for the butcher to a weight of 250 - 300 kilos. Lambs bought in the Autumn are also fattened for the local butcher, but the pigs are on contract to one of the largest grain millers in the area. The harvest this year was particularly difficult with a very wet July and August but an unusually dry Autumn enabled above average yields. Oats and Barley are home grown for use as fodder. Prices have remained stable for livestock over the year and do not appear to have kept pace with price rises in other commodities.
